intro: Cyrtochloa hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy cyrtochloa, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and hairy foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Cyrtochloa hirsuta is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
